Key Match Events: Draymond Green recorded a game-high five blocks, four of which on Zion Williamson who was held to the lowest field goal percentage of his career (25 percent, 5-for-20)
Post-Match Reflections: Head Coach Steve Kerr said, 'The way he battled out there, the way he led and his energy. He was fantastic.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors have the second-best defensive rating in the league (98.4), only trailing Holmgren's Thunder (91.3), who also have All-Defensive guard Alex Caruso
Others: Draymond Green believes his name remains in the conversation among the league's best defenders and the film from Wednesday night's win over the Pelicans has great campaign footage
Green consistently takes the challenge of guarding the opposing team's top forwards, with his final block coming on a Brandon Ingram 3-pointer

Green is a 6'5 rim protector who is also skilled at switching out onto the perimeter. He can guard on and off the ball and switch one through five. Very few players in the league are as impactful and versatile defensively and two of them — Victor Wembanyama and Chet Holmgren — are 7-plus footers who are early in their second season, without the decade-plus of production on their resume
